item.title: Report X-2024050320
item.description:
Report X-2024050320

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-10T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-04
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shipment external packaging was wet on underside and also dented on two corners. Leak source came from three out of the four gallon size plastic bottles of Cidehol70, 70% Isopropyl alcohol whose caps were not completely sealed. All four bottles were in a tied off plastic bag. No inner cushioning evident.

item.title: Report E-2024050119
item.description:
Report E-2024050119

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-09T15:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 05-PAIL that was strapped down too tightly crushing the body and causing the lid to pop open. This resulted in an estimated 1-gallon release that impacted the plastic shrink wrap in a 1’x1’ area. A Contractor overpacked the damaged, leaking PAIL, containerized the impacted shrink wrap, and cleaned-up the release with absorbent rags. In total, two drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

item.title: Report X-2024050140
item.description:
Report X-2024050140

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-01
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package handler noticed a strong odor coming from hazmat package and informed management. QA-Admin was called to collect the package and placed it inside a hazmat bag with absorbent, and bag was placed inside a hazmat tote. Package was brought to vent. Upon further investigation the QA discovered one of the bottles had a loose cap and entire contents leaked out of one bottle.
